column5: After reading this post, I could not help but begin to cry. Losing a loved one is very difficult. I know from experience as I also lost my older brother, fishing buddy, best friend, back in April 08. Words cannot comfort the pain that you and your family must be going through. In difficult times like these, people really never know what to say, especially if they didn't know the person. Lean on your friends for strength, and always remember how much you are cared about. May your memories give you strength. They help me in times of need.  God Bless.
I was an only child but always wished I'd had a brother...  Your's sounds like the kind I'd liked to have had...
A fine tribute to a fine man... you have my thoughts and prayers. HH
My condolences to you and your family
My condolences to you and your family

Holy Cow Steve.  Losing someone that close is real tough and hard.  Sure sounds like your brother made such a positive impact on your own life and has set the example for many to live by.  Allow Patsy and I to share our deepest condolences at this time to you and your family.
Deeply sadening.  I hope he can see just how much you care about him.  HD
My condolences, I'm sure he will be greatly missed.
My condolences to you and your family.  Sounds like he was a fantastic person and will be truly missed.
That is a beautiful tribute; he sounds like a truly excellent man.  My most sincere condolences to you and your family.

Last Monday, my Brother, Brian Paul, suffered a heart attack while playing hockey and passed away.  My life, and the lives of our family will never be the same without this incredible man in it.  Trying to find the right words to write about him is difficult because none seem sufficient to say what he meant to me.  He was 15 years older than me but always took the time when I was young to spend time with me, the greatest gift he could have given to me.  I learned so much from him just by watching him and being with him.  No matter what a hellion I was a child, he always came back for more.  He was truly one of the most brilliant people I have ever met and could help you solve any problem - mechanical or personal, just by talking you through it.  He was the consumate husband, father, brother, uncle and son.  He was living his dream, living on the water with his beautiful wife, getting ready for retirement, enjoying quiet time on his boat just cruising up and down the Rideau, anchoring in quiet bays for the night just to enjoy the beauty that nature provides.  He was fiercely proud of my nephew and niece, and rightfully so as they are great kids, I can only hope to provide them the support to get through this that they need.  His giving and caring nature has continued with my son and daughter and they have lost the best uncle you could imagine having.  Life will never be the same for me with Brian gone.  But life continues on and he would want everyone to go on and celebrate life the way he did.  As my nephew Sean said in his tribute to Brian at the funeral, "When you want to honour Brian, don't raise a glass to him, just do what he would have done and do something nice for someone without asking anything in return"  You will be missed Brian.  Brian teaching my daughter Jess how to sail this summer    Brian and Jess on the Cruiser this summer    My brother and I, his son Sean, my kids Ryan and Jess, our motley crue of dogs and of course the Peeing Moose a couple of summers back    My son Ryan and Brian enjoying the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Calendar a few years ago at Christmas
Sorry for your loss Steve. How old was Brian?
Treasure the memories.
That is a beautiful tribute......sorry for your loss!
My condolences to you and your family.
My condolences to you
My condolences sorry for your loss, your memories and the good times with family is what you'll need to get thru.
My condolences also to you, I feel your pain. I lost my Mom last Tuesday December 30th, 2008.
Sorry for your loss.  This seems to be happening a lot lately.  Sinker
My condolences i lost my borther a few years ago.  I remember all the good times and live my life as he is there right beside me....... hang in there buddy
What a great tribute -- thank you for sharing that with us....our thoughts are with you and your family.
Hey Steve. Sorry to hear of your loss my friend. Brothers are for ever,you have some great memories of one that sounds like the perfect brother.  My thoughtst and prayers are with you bud.
My condolences.
Sorry to hear about your loss, my deepest sympathies to you and your family.  Leechman
He was 57 Wayne.    Our condolences to you as well on the loss of your mother.   He truly was the perfect brother.
Very sorry to read this Steve, my heart goes out to you and your family.
My condolences to you and your family  Rob
Great tribute Paul! I have a Brother who is 14 yrs my senior and like a Father to me in many ways, I couldn't imagine life here without him. My condolences to you and your family.  Dax
Very sorry to hear this news...  Our condolences to you and your family...and to all who knew him.  This was a very fitting tribute...  Cliff and Carole
It sounds like he left you with many wonderful memories to cherish. I am sorry for your loss. Jim
My condolences. You and your family are in the thoughts and prayers of me and mine.
im sorry to hear about your loss steve..older brothers are special i have two of them i cant imagine the loss..
So very sorry to hear of your loss Steve.
My condolences on your loss as well Steve. Sounds like he was pretty special.
My sympathies to you and your family.  Losing a close family member is very tough.
